meanings.definition: To refuse to acknowledge or accept ownership of something.
meanings.sent1: The man decided to disown his old car and buy a new one instead.
meanings.sent2: She disowns any responsibility for the mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disown the broken vase by pretending to be asleep nearby.
meanings.sent4: His actions clearly disown any connection to the crime.
meanings.sent5: The company's logo disowns any resemblance to their competitor's design.

meanings.definition: A person who refuses to acknowledge or accept ownership of something.
meanings.sent1: The disowner of the lost wallet was found and returned it to its owner.
meanings.sent2: The disowners of the abandoned house were nowhere to be found.
meanings.sent3: The disowner of the stolen bike joked that they were now a 'bikeless wonder'.
meanings.sent4: The disowner of the mysterious package was the talk of the town.
meanings.sent5: The disowner of the rare painting was unaware of its true value.
